data.Description: Restores hit points to a creature.
data.Mechanic Description: The target regains hit points, usually based on the caster's spellcasting ability or a fixed value (e.g., 1d3 + spellcasting ability modifier).

data.Description: Deals damage to a creature or area.
data.Mechanic Description: Targets suffer damage based on a damage roll (e.g., 1d3) or a fixed value. This is considered the default source of the user's main damage.

data.Description: Weakens or hinders a creature.
data.Mechanic Description: Applies negative effects to the target, such as reduced attack rolls, movement speed, or ability checks. Any unique debuff is considered interpretative.

data.Description: Enhances a creature's abilities or stats.
data.Mechanic Description: Grants bonuses such as increased damage, defense, or speed. Default values: damage buff uses 1d3, defense buff grants +1 AC, and speed buff adds 4.5 ft. Any unique buff is considered interpretative.

data.Description: Restricts a creature’s actions or movements.
data.Mechanic Description: Applies effects like restraining, paralyzing, or confusing the target, significantly limiting their abilities. Any unique control effect is considered interpretative.

data.Description: Summons creatures or objects to assist the caster.
data.Mechanic Description: Conjures creatures or objects to obey the caster’s commands, often with limited strength or utility.

data.Description: Instantly moves the caster or another creature to a different location.
data.Mechanic Description: Transports the caster or a target to a different location, usually within a specific range.

data.Description: Targets multiple creatures in a defined area.
data.Mechanic Description: Applies effects like damage, healing, buffs, or debuffs to all creatures within a certain radius. Typically includes a saving throw to reduce the effect.

data.Description: Makes a creature unseen by others.
data.Mechanic Description: Renders the target invisible, making it harder for enemies to attack them. The effect may still be nullified under specific conditions.

data.Description: Instills fear in creatures.
data.Mechanic Description: Affected creatures must make a saving throw or become frightened, often causing them to flee or become unable to act effectively.

data.Description: Influences a creature’s perception and allegiance.
data.Mechanic Description: Makes a creature friendly or charmed by the caster, reducing hostility or improving cooperation.

data.Description: Manipulates one of the basic elements (fire, water, earth, air).
data.Mechanic Description: Allows the caster to control an element, such as summoning fire or shaping earth, for damage or environmental alteration.

data.Description: Manipulates life force or reanimates the dead.
data.Mechanic Description: Drains hit points from living creatures or raises undead servants from corpses.

data.Description: Calls upon a deity for aid in dire situations.
data.Mechanic Description: Requests a deity's help, often granting a powerful one-time effect that can significantly alter the outcome of events.

data.Description: Alters the emotions or minds of creatures.
data.Mechanic Description: Makes the target more susceptible to suggestions, commands, or affection, influencing their behavior.

data.Description: Manipulates time to speed it up, slow it down, or freeze it.
data.Mechanic Description: Affects time within a localized area or for the caster, granting extra actions or creating temporal effects.

data.Description: Shields creatures from harm.
data.Mechanic Description: Creates a magical barrier or ward to reduce or negate damage or harmful effects on the target.

data.Description: Creates deceptive images or sounds to fool the senses.
data.Mechanic Description: The caster creates an illusion to deceive creatures into perceiving something false.

data.Description: Open to the DM's interpretation.
data.Mechanic Description: Effects are decided by the DM and can vary depending on the situation.

data.Description: Time the spell remains active.
data.Mechanic Description: Determines the number of rounds the spell is active during combat. Default duration is 3 rounds.

data.Description: Number of times the skill can be used.
data.Mechanic Description: Limits the number of uses for the skill, defined by the user.
